paper_abstract: The structure map turning a set into the carrier of a final coalgebra is not unique This fact is well known but commonly elided In this paper we argue that any such concrete representation of a set as a final coalgebra is potentially interesting on its own We discuss several examples in particular we consider different coalgebra structures that turn the set of infinite streams into the carrier of a final coalgebra After that we focus on coalgebra structures that are made up using so-called cooperations We say that a collection of cooperations is complete for a given set X if it gives rise to a coalgebra structure that turns X into the carrier set of a subcoalgebra of a final coalgebra Any complete set of cooperations yields a coalgebralc proof and definition principle We exploit this fact and devise a general definition scheme for constants and functions on a set X that is parametrical in the choice of the complete set of cooperations for X (C) 2010 Published by Elsevier Inc
